intro: Limniris maackii, commonly known as the Maack's limniris, is a species of flowering plant native to eastern Asia. It belongs to the family Rosaceae, which includes roses and other shrubs. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, white to pale pink flowers. It typically grows in woodland areas and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
